rev.comment: add whorton back in with more modest quote
How about a nice, neutral source that puts the claims in the appropriate context, showing how they have been responded to by the mainstream? (as per [[WP:NPOV/FAQ#Pseudoscience]])
The positive studies could be given a brief mention, but this long insertion of a direct quote of an opinion has no place in the lead.
reedit to reflect quotes
The statement that there are positive results also needs to be sourced.
Another wording of Whorton's point with some italics to make direct quotes clearer
"Would be prudent" is a conclusion by you, rather than a paraphrase of the source. Reverting.
use direct quote to avoid weasel words
prudent qualification of Whorton
Added internal link (wikification)
/* High dilutions */
/* High dilutions */ It's not really that exact - the amount of the original subsrtance used, and the amount of the final dilution placed onto the pill matter and may make this closerto 23X or less
/* High dilutions */ remove sentence. I don't object to readding a mention of Water memory, but can we do so more neutrally, with betters sources, etc at a more appropriate point?
his first two edits were uncontroversial improvements
rvt undiscussed consensus-free unilateral changes; pls discuss at talk FIRST
/* Research on medical effectiveness */ Statement was true, but notability hasn't been proven. Regarding the journal: "Evidence-based" implies regular, so the title does not bode well.

/* Research on medical effectiveness */ Unreliable source indeed! This is the Heather Boon of "physicists won't dismiss its theories". An "open mind" type who's really just a proponent. A bit like ID.
/* High dilutions */ The only one cited was [[Rustum Roy]]. Thought about changing it to "[[Rustum Roy]] maintains" etc. For that he had to be notable. I read up on him, turns out he's a total quack.
/* High dilutions */ remove stray ]
/* Dilution and succussion */ tweak Notes in table
/* Dilution and succussion */ adding easy to read chart explaining dilution strengths
Homeopathy is scientifically implausible and "is diametrically opposed to modern pharmaceutical knowledge."
adding page number to source
adding source and rewriting text to match what the source says
